results.title: Beautiful Boy
results.brief_description: Jim Evans fondly looks back at his relationship with his son Gareth. Gareth was in his 30’s when he was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis.
results.description: Jim Evans fondly looks back at his relationship with his son Gareth. Gareth was in his 30’s when he was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis.

results.title: The Airport
results.brief_description: Bridget Robertson goes to the airport to collect her sister’s body. She reflects on Tina’s life, cut short at 25 in a motor bike accident.

results.title: Artist: unknown
results.brief_description:
Being a struggling artist is tough at the best of times but when you’re thousands of miles from home, your debts are mounting and you’re making no money, something’s got to give.
Amy made the long trip from Australia to London to paint. The rent on her workspace is now a month overdue, the landlord is knocking and working part-time in a cafe is not making ends meet. She could try selling her work - but that would entail showing people.
Shot on location in London with original music by Horse Stories. Produced, directed and written by Catherine Green.

details.label: Subject categories
display_values: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology → Reality

results.title: Backthenrightnowlateron
results.creator_credit: Queensland Performing Arts Centre, David Megarrity and Luke Monsour
results.brief_description:
Mixing interviews, images and tiny fictions, “Backthenrightnowlateron” is a funny and moving collection of children’s thoughts on their past, present and future.
The work is divided into three segments - Backthen, Rightnow, Lateron. Each segment features children from Class 2J, Yeronga State School, with their favourite toy sharing their thoughts with interviewer Georgia Seffrin, and a mini-film starring one of the toys - Chicky goes to nana’s house, Red Ted goes to England, Minotaur goes to war. Provides a wonderful and amusing insight into young children’s minds.
Developed from an original concept and commission by QPAC’s “Out of the Box” Festival of Early Childhood for the OOTB Symposium, September 2003.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Queensland Performing Arts Centre, David Megarrity and Luke Monsour

results.title: If you are not part of the solution...you are part of the problem
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Libby Lloyd
results.brief_description: Violence against women is possibly the most important, least examined and most taboo subject in our society. This film explores the beginnings of White Ribbon Day and the campaign to making it an important high profile public awareness day in Australia.
results.title_for_label: If you are not part of the solution…you are part of the problem

results.title: Finding me
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Joy Chivers
results.brief_description: Through years of domestic violence Joy existed in the silence of the shadows, afraid to cry out, to seek help, to seek support. Broken bones and bruises heal but the emotional scarring lasts a lifetime.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Joy Chivers

results.title: Lesson plan
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Jeannine le Vaillant-Moffitt
results.brief_description: I have no “me” memories of my childhood aged before 7, but many memories of my siblings. A story of memories, family, love and acceptance.
